diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Persistent right knee pain, swelling, worse at night.

treatmentPlan.modality: Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy followed by Neoadjuvant External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT), followed by planned surgery.
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV encompassing gross tumor volume (GTV based on MRI) + margin, including biopsy track potentially. Aim to spare distal femoral physis if possible.
treatmentPlan.priorSystemicChemo: Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy (MAP: Methotrexate, Adriamycin, Cisplatin) - Completed 04/01/2025
treatmentPlan.plannedSurgery: Wide resection and endoprosthetic reconstruction (scheduled post-RT)
medications: Monitor for skin reaction, joint stiffness

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine with custom leg immobilization (Vac-Lok or alpha cradle). SAD setup.
ctSimulation.immobilization: Vac-Lok or alpha cradle for R leg
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT acquired post-chemo. Fused with recent post-chemo MRI for IMRT planning.

dosimetry.constraints: Femoral Head < 40 Gy; Skin Max < 50 Gy; Epiphyseal plate (physis) dose minimized

fractions.setupNotes: Daily kV imaging, match to bone/clips. Setup consistent.
fractions.sideEffects: Mild skin erythema (Grade 1). No joint limitation noted.
fractions.notes: Physical therapy for ROM exercises ongoing. Tolerating well.

imagingAndReports.summary: Aggressive lesion distal femur, periosteal reaction (Codman's triangle, sunburst).

imagingAndReports.type: MRI Right Femur w/ & w/o Contrast
imagingAndReports.summary: Large enhancing mass distal femur metaphysis (8cm) with extensive marrow involvement and soft tissue extension.

imagingAndReports.type: MRI Right Femur w/ & w/o Contrast (Post-Chemo)
imagingAndReports.summary: Interval decrease in enhancement and soft tissue component, consistent with treatment response. Residual tumor measures approx 6 cm.
Non-contrast CT fused with recent post-chemo MRI for IMRT planning.

labResults.notes: Counts recovering post-MAP chemo. OK for RT.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Nancy Green (Peds Ortho)
progressNotes.summary: 17yo M with R knee pain/swelling. Imaging concerning for osteosarcoma distal femur. Refer to Ortho Onc / Peds Onc for biopsy and staging.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Jones / Dr. Roberts
progressNotes.summary: Case reviewed: Localized high-grade osteosarcoma R distal femur. Plan: Neoadjuvant MAP chemo x ~3 months, followed by pre-operative RT, then limb-sparing surgery (wide resection + endoprosthesis).

progressNotes.author: Dr. Sarah Jones (Peds Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Kevin completed planned MAP chemo. Tolerated with expected toxicities (mucositis, myelosuppression managed w/ GCSF). Post-chemo MRI shows good response. Cleared to proceed with pre-op RT. Refer back to Rad Onc.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Brian Carter (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt ready for pre-op RT for R distal femur osteosarcoma. Reviewed post-chemo MRI. Plan for IMRT to 55.8Gy/31fx. Discussed goals (improve local control pre-op), procedure, potential SEs (skin reaction, fatigue, joint stiffness, low risk growth plate effect). Pt/Family agree. CT sim scheduled.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Brian Carter (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Tolerating RT well. Mild skin erythema (Gr 1). No joint limitation noted. Continue RT. Physical therapy referral made for ROM exercises.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Pre-operative radiation to further shrink the tumor and kill any microscopic cancer cells at the edges to make surgery safer and more effective.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Skin reaction (redness, dryness, peeling), fatigue, potential for temporary joint stiffness in the knee, very small risk of long-term effects on bone growth (as he is near skeletal maturity).
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Importance of range-of-motion exercises as guided by physical therapy to prevent joint stiffness. Skin care (moisturizers, avoiding irritants).
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT, perform PT exercises, report any severe skin reaction or increased pain.
